website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for clamps for a 1" bar, consider this easy-on-easy-off pair from Greententljs.
pros: Pair of barbell collar clamps made of nylon, steel and rubber
Easy-on and off for people with arthritis
cons: May not hold heavy weights on the bar through multiple repetitions

customer_reviews.title: They seemed to work until they failed to hold
customer_reviews.text: They seemed to work until they failed to hold 45lbs on the right side of my bar that I happened to lean a little to far to the right when placing back on the rack. A 10lb weight from the bar resulted in attached. I am partly at fault, however, they should have been able to hold the weights in place.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Worked really well with my threaded bar
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with these despite my threaded bar and found a little electrical tape worked wonders to help keep these perfectly tight without getting in the way of my plates. I was skeptical to buy these based on other reviews since my bar is threaded, but it worked out and I'm glad I tried them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Reeds

customer_reviews.title: Value/performance/price. And looks good too!
customer_reviews.text: These clips are great! A perfectly snug fit on a solid 1" bar. Not so tight that it's hard to close, but tight enough that there's no way the weights will move around. Not a snug fit on a threaded 1" bar...but I don't think that's the product's fault. I have not been able to find a clip like this that is snug on a threaded bar. I highly recommend these clips. Great value, great performance, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Clamps, Quick and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: These clamps are great, and quick and easy to use. I don't understand the people giving these a bad review due to them not holding much weight. The item is described as a BARBELL clamp, not a dumbbell clamp. These are made for horizontal barbells, and that is the only thing you should be utilizing them for. I use them on both a solid ended barbell and a threaded ended barbell and they work on either. They do fit a bit more snug on the smooth, solid ended barbells, but they work on either.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Watch out! They don't hold the weight on!
customer_reviews.text: These clamps don't work at all! I mean, they clamp to the bar, but they don't stay on. My husband was doing chest flies & after a few reps the clamp wiggled up & the weight started to fall off. It could've hit him in the face! We threw them away & just went back to using the screw-on ones that came with the weight bars. As far as I'm concerned, these are dangerous & give a false sense of security.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS. Seriously be careful.
customer_reviews.text: I should've read reviews on these types of clamps better - the problem is that they don't have a secure enough clasp so that it's 'easy' to remove, but that makes them dangerous, if you're doing reps and it just SLIPS OFF you could seriously injure yourself. BE CAREFUL! don't do any movements that puts a barbell or dumbbell handle perpendicular to the ground, that means no behind-the-head tricep curls, and DO NOT TRUST THESE for doing ANY reps over your head.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Works on Threaded bars.
customer_reviews.text: Reviewed after just 2 works outs with them. Works on 1 in threaded bars. Not perfect, but good enough for me. I dislike threading my 6 ft straight bar and easy bar. These are a decent replacement. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie S.

customer_reviews.title: Good “insurance” clamps, WITH your existing locks!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read a couple of reviews, that ding these clamps for the insecure(?) lock they provide. Granted, if I was a HEAVY weight lifter, and these were my only weight locks, for quick weight changes, I might be concerned. I bought these, as “insurance” clamps, to supplement the spin-lock weight locks, which invariably spin, WHILE you’re lifting! This is annoying at best, but can be dangerous, as well. Having these, combined with the spin locks, ensures the weights aren’t going anywhere, and stops the annoying clatter of loose weight plates!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Threaded Sleeves Only
customer_reviews.text: These are a great replacement for the nut-style collars that go on threaded sleeves, but they slip on my smooth-sleeved barbell. Get the cheaper spring clips if your bar has smooth collars--my Cap clips do not slip at all. I bought both styles of clips to see which ones work better (reviews for both mentioned slipping), and I am only keeping these because they work on the threaded collars of my other barbell. I would be returning these as defective if I only had the smooth sleeves.
customer_reviews.author: Brad G

customer_reviews.title: They work on spiral bars just fine!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 1 inch CAP brand weight bar with the spiral ends and thought, "cr@p, I hate spinning the weight stoppers on and off, it takes Forever!" and I can't do quick transitions in BodyPump and be held back by the spinner guards. I bought these and they lock down tight on the spiral bar with no problems. They're also available in cute colors. Shipped fast, good quality, so happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Failed to hold weight.
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous. Not made for heavy weight. I had them set up on a pair of screw type dumbbells. I had 35 lb pounds on each side of the dumbbell for dumbbell bench press. I went to start the exercise and one of the clips failed to hold the weight. This caused the weight to slide off and the rest of it to fall into my chest, kinda like one of those fail videos. I will just stick the the screw type for now.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Works great - slight modifications to dumbbells may be required.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read some complaints that the clamps aren’t super secure on certain 1” sleeves. We found that the clamps are PRETTY secure but they can still be shook down a little on our dumbbells. I saw a recommendation from another user to use electrical tape or heat shrink on the sleeves, so I tried that. It made a SIGNIFICANT difference on our dumbbells - I’d have no fears doing overhead press or skullcrushers with these dumbbells and clamps now. I highly recommend this modification, especially because using these clamps is WAY faster than using the default screw clamps most dumbells come with.
customer_reviews.author: A. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Garbage for my golds gym bars
customer_reviews.text: These were the correct size for my golds gym bars. The original bars use a threaded ring to secure the weights. I figured these would have enough tension to grip despite them only having contact with around 1/2 of the metal because of the threading. There is only one tightness settings though, and even with the rubber grips inside of them, the tightness is far from sufficient. I'd no sooner put the weights on the bar (not even heavy, but around 20lbs) and put the clamp on, than it would start to become loose. They may work for some products, but they were total garbage for me.
customer_reviews.author: Terry D

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, mediocre grip
customer_reviews.text: I don't put them under much stress but have dropped them a few times and they have not broken, but they do not grip as well as the clamps in the gym (same bar, same weights) but that only affects loading of the bar (full vertical) not actual usage. it cannot keep 30lbs of plates from slipping in full vertical position but keeps them secure under horizontal usage up to 40lb that I use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 1” bar
customer_reviews.text: This horrible. I purchased a Body Rock bar that is 1”. This is supposed to fit 1” but it will not come close to fitting. Purchased a 2” just to see and it is WAY too big. So frustrating. Read a previous review about having to shave some rubber. May try that and lose my $9 but it almost seems like too much would have to be shaved.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney C.

customer_reviews.title: Holds fast
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace the nut type retainers that came with my barbell, they're pretty great, hold tight, slide on and off much quicker than threading the oems all the way on and off, and no hazard of flaking chrome. Only complaint, the open position could stand to be just a little bigger in diameter, they drag just a little and I fear it may eventually result in the rubber delaminating. Overall, a huge improvement, I happily recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my bars
customer_reviews.text: Sad these did not fit my 1inch barbell and handles. It did fit my 1inch threaded dumbell handles however. Had to return because their main purpose was meant for the barbell. I suspect the thick cushion in the interior of the clamp is what prevented from them working. I don't blame the company, just the difference in how equipment is made. Easy to return.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Used on CAP Barbell Dumbbell with smooth Handles, 14" ...
customer_reviews.text: Used on CAP Barbell Dumbbell with smooth Handles, 14". Had 20lbs per side while doing lying triceps extensions. Clamps slipped right of during third rep. use product with caution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essential for Your Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. I already had the Olympic size in these clamps, and was tired of dealing with those stupid butterfly clamps clanging around loosely on my standard bar. The threaded types hold better than butterfly clamps, but tend to spin loose as you lift, and they take too long to get on and off when switching plates in the middle of a workout. These little miracles hold the plates in place perfectly, switch out quickly, and I no longer worry about the plates sliding off if I happen to tilt the bar a little bit during a heavy lift.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These barbell clamps were great to use about a year ago. Since then, they have changed them, and they are now unusable. The clamps are currently too tight to close on the barbells in either of the two gyms that I visit. I have switched to the Lock-Jaw One barbell clamps which work real good. Hopefully, the Lock-Jaw clamps will take off and offer a greater variety of fun colors.
customer_reviews.author: Houston Sue

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, doesn't fit, pretty
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I have arthritic hands and the old spring style clips can be difficult for me. I was happy to have an option and paid 4 times what the old style clips would have cost. They arrived in good time but they don't fit the 1" CAP dumbbells I have. I can just barely force them onto the end of the bar but because they use rubber pads to hold to the bar I can't slide them down to the weight. Lesson learned. I'm waiting on the old cheap spring style clips now.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Purser

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: The hold is amazing on both 1 inch solid bar and screw type bar. Only issue is getting them on the solid type bar for dumbells. Future request would be to have them open a little farther to accommodate variations in 1 inch bars. Update (1/3/20): broke! Be warned, have only had these for 4 months and one already broke. Really liked these over the spring clamp type, but not if there is a chance of the snapping.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Only safe in horizontal position.
customer_reviews.text: A lot easier than the plastic twist on one I had, but not very safe for some exercises such as overhead tricep extensions or pullovers. The clamp kept moving with each rep. You can. See how much the clamp moved with only 12.5 lbs and 10 reps. Pretty bummed about that as these are the only DB I have that I can adjust the weight for heavier amounts. Good for horizontal like in curls, presses, etc, just don't trust them to hold vertically.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware DANGER
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4, 3 months ago. That’s about how long they worked for. Flaw in design they use only grip and clamp to stay tight. Weights fell off more than once. Clamp just lets them slowly get loose. This is with me checking before every set after first scary fall. Waste of money and DANGEROUS...ONLY way to use is after using the thread star.
customer_reviews.author: Raphael Madrigal

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT safe! These do not clamp down properly and are fairly loose. I’ve been lifting for 15 years and built my own gym in the garage so it’s not user error. Would strongly advise against using these to secure anything over 10lbs (on each side). After a few uses, some of the pins have started to fall out. Really bad quality not to mention a great way to get seriously hurt when doing anything but using baby weights.
customer_reviews.author: Marcio F. Dacosta

customer_reviews.title: Clip doesn’t snap into place on barbell
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the set I received seems to be defective after a couple of uses. One of the clips no longer snaps into place and will not hold the weight on the end of my barbell. I have purchased 3 sets the other two work decently and well this set does not.
customer_reviews.author: robert blum

customer_reviews.title: Works, easy to use and put on and off.
customer_reviews.text: Needed some clamps for a new set that came with an Olympic sleeve and clamp over a 1" bar. Removed the Olympic sleeve and needed a 1" clamp. Worked fine, seems to hold tight. 50-50 on whether easier than the same type spring metal clamp (that are cheaper) which require a good grip. These take some force to close. The advantage is you can just slide them, then clamp. The Spring type clips require a firm grip and a long slide to the right spot. These just slide then clamp. Worth the slight extra cost, in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Gus&Erin

customer_reviews.title: Crappy product!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work on threaded bars, even though it says it will. I will say that it sort of helps with weights not coming off, but not to where it helps me much. If I had the patience to return these, I would! The clasp opens rather easily which makes it a very ineffective product for what it is intended! I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KS2017

customer_reviews.title: On a 1 in. smooth bar these work ideal!!
customer_reviews.text: I like them. You push on the handle to open them wide open, push it down to lock them on. Then when ready to remove push once again on the flap handle to open them up all the way holding it wide open as you slide them off. If you do this they won't be hard to put on or take off. But if you just try to slide them on and off without pushing them all the way open they will be a chore to take on and off. Push the collars toward the middle as you close them to make sure the weights are tightly secured. Common sense really. Like the different colors too.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous with some weight sets!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT USE these if you have weights with ridges on the sides like in the attached photo! These ridges will cause the clamp to unlock when the weights rotate on the bar. They then slide off REALLY easily. I just finished a workout where one of these came loose and slid off the end of the bar. Thankfully my daughter was near by to put it back as I was in the middle of a bar bell squat set!
customer_reviews.author: BEarl

customer_reviews.title: They are sturdy as sturdy gets
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with how well these work, on both smooth and threaded bars. I have a local gym membership, but occasionally opt to work out at home. They clamp down on the threaded bars very tightly, allowing for a much quicker change over time when adding/removing plates. I honestly have no clue how other amazon users are breaking them? They are sturdy as sturdy gets, for being plastic. I liked them so much, I just ordered more. A great, inexpensive addition to anyone with a home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Morbidcorpse

customer_reviews.title: These work as they should
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with one of the pair of clamps. When I contacted the seller the problem was rectified in short order. I highly recommend the seller. I like that these make changing plates easier than the spring clamps I was using before. The only caution I have is to be careful of the weight being held. Each clamp, on the painted 14" dumbbell bars I use, is able to support 35 pounds. When I tried 40 pounds, the clamp was not able to hold it. It may have done so if your bars are longer or have a different finish.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford F.

customer_reviews.title: Right tool, wrong size
customer_reviews.text: Well, I was going to give a low score until I remembered that it was MY fault it was the wrong size. I wanted the ones for 2” Olympic size bars and dumbbells and this is for something at 1”. I have never seen a one inch bar myself, so this will not work for me. However, these are made and designed just like the 2” models and would do the job just fine. Hit me up if you want to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD H SCIBEK

customer_reviews.title: Missing Quality
customer_reviews.text: These clamps are very low quality. I used them only three times before the locking pin on clamps fell out making them useless. By the second time, I used them they were already showing signs of being loose and that they would not hold weight on the bar securely. I am glad I figured this out soon and will be returning. I would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart but works
customer_reviews.text: Buy these if they are the only ones in stock! The idea behind the design is good and higher quality ones work well but I do not recommend these specific clamps if you are looking for quality construction. One of the small stainless pins that holds the clamps together fell out on the first use so I have to reinsert in every time I use it and hopefully not lose it. I would have returned these clamps but I needed to use them immediately and every day thereafter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seemed too tight at first
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace those super-annoying spring clips. At first I thought these weren't going to work because sliding them on/off the bar, even when fully open, was really hard - way too much friction. However, if you leave them clipped shut on the bar then the rubber packs down a bit in a day or so, and they're a joy to use - open and they move freely, close and they stay put. I keep mine on my 1" smooth barbell between sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Fiennes

customer_reviews.title: Too small for Body Pump bars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Body Pump classes and it was nearly impossible to get the clamps onto the bar--then the struggle of clamping down. A big fail on my top priority of easily changing out weights. After shaving off a little of the inside padding they work better now. They should stop claiming to fit all 1" bars or make a slightly bigger clip.
customer_reviews.author: Washer Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and comes in different colors!
customer_reviews.text: These barbell clips are easy to use for the 1-inch barbell, and are the same ones at my gym. I got a couple of them in different colors so I will remember to put them back in my bag after the workout. The ones at the gym are black, and often times they run out when the class is full. They are also light enough to have a permanent place in my gym bag.
customer_reviews.author: AmazingAmazon

customer_reviews.title: These work great
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to use and work great. Much better than the traditional clamps. My only complaint is that I should have gotten another color like neon yellow. The black ones blend right into the black rubber mats on my gym floor and I end up hunting for these things. I would point out that they are not quite as easy to use as the bigger 2" Olympic size ones but that is a minor complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Significantly speeds up my workouts.
customer_reviews.text: These clips make it much, much easier to change out the weights on my barbell and have made workouts much faster. This was especially important when lifting with a partner who was lifting different weights from me and switching back and forth took a lot of time. I'm always careful to keep the bar more or less flat because I wouldn't trust these to hold the weights up if the bar was tilted vertically. That being said, they do a good job of keeping the weights tight and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Cheap.  Don't trust them to hold a lot of weight.
customer_reviews.text: These things are really cheap. I don't trust them to hold more than about 15 lbs per side on the dumbbell. They also come with a bunch of silicone grease gobbed in the joints, which is great for the joints, but it gets on the bar and causes the collar to slip. I personally don't feel like silicone grease belongs in household items like this because it's impossible to clean, and eventually ends up on your hands and in your mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Collars!
customer_reviews.text: These collars are excellent. They slip over the bar and close with a latch. The fit one-inch weight lifting bars snugly (I use them on one-inch bars that come threaded with collars that spin on. These are far more easy and quick to use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Safety Hazard, do not use
customer_reviews.text: Even worse than being useless, this product is a huge safety hazard. Twice I had them come loose in the middle of doing lifts, one case was a very close call, only thing that saved the person was their quick reaction when a weight was hurdling toward them, it was 5 lbs but when u add height and speed to that 5lbs we are talking about serious injury. I could not even give these to anyone, because I would only be endangering others, had to throw the away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: User Friendly, Excellently Functioning Barbell Clamps!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these barbell clamps for my husband and son. They work and function safely and securely. They are user friendly as they do not require much effort to secure them yet they do their job by keeping the weights securely in place. No more twisting those old collars on...what a relief these clamps are. They make your work out so much easier and less time consuming. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: I like this little gizmo
customer_reviews.text: I like this little gizmo. I use barbells and dumbbells with 1” holes, not Olympic style, in my basement gym, and there are times when I must quickly add plates as I lift through pyramids, or whatever, and don’t want to mess with unscrewing the silver star knobs all the time. This little gizmos work quite well for that limited purpose. I do NOT recommend them for regular use, as they do not completely secure the additional plates, and with any serious tipping, painful or disastrous consequences could result. But for 8 bucks or whatever, they work well.
customer_reviews.author: kim west

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but difficult on/off
customer_reviews.text: This looks like it will hold up just fine. The only problem is that if your bar has exactly 1" diameter bar, then these clips are really stubborn to get on and off. So if you are looking for quick-switching of plates in between sets, you might be out of luck. We are hoping they will loosen just enough over time to make switching easier. In the meantime, you get a bit of a workout just getting these clips on/off. We ordered the lime green. Nice assortment of colors if you want to avoid plain black. (We got colored ones so they wouldn't get "lost" or camouflaged against out black gym matting.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great and don't have to retighten them like my old collars.
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of chrome plated dumbbells and a couple of curl bars that are threaded on the ends and have the threaded collars that came with them. If anyone has ever used these you know how often you have to keep retighten these things. I bought these collars to save me the aggravation of having to do that. They work great and I'll never use the old collars again.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Not safe!!
customer_reviews.text: One of mine broke and the other slid down the shaft of my barbell while I was doing shoulder presses. Two 10-pound weights fell off the end and the two on the other side almost fell off as well. Someone could have been seriously injured, especially if I had been lifting more weight. I can't seem to find a "maximum weight" warning anywhere on the product page. Until they broke I liked them; they were quick and easy to use, and I assume they would be safe on dumbbells with lower weight amounts attached.
customer_reviews.author: kevbot

customer_reviews.title: Safe and secure
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know they made these types of clamps for 1” barbells! The normal clamps were useless as they would slide right off even with the smallest tilt. These clamps feel secure and the rubber paddings do a great job at preventing slides. They are a little tricky to put on at first but after they’re broken in, they work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: When my standard 1" bar arrived with a terrible pair of spring clips I immediately sought out a pair of clamps like we use in Body Pump classes at the gym. According to the specs, these should be a perfect fit, but sadly they are too small. I'm afraid the 2" will be too big and not clamp securely on my bar, so I guess I'll have to try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my application
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these to go with the standard plate hex/trap bar, also sold on Amazon. These worked great for that application, where the movement is limited and straight up and down. They hold the plates tight. I could see issues if someone were to use them and tip a bar drastically to one side. With "normal" and/or "proper" use of bars, there shouldn't be an issue with these.
customer_reviews.author: mcramblet

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made overseas product
customer_reviews.text: They just slide right off on their own, so they get a 5 star rating for ease of removal FOR SURE!!! Not to mention I feel terrible about buying products manufactured overseas, contributing to the acceptance of slave labor. Definitely will be returning. I want something higher quality and SAFE to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bio Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: They're easier, and are secure, but they don't tighten.
customer_reviews.text: They're easier to put on than screw-clamps, of course, and they do keep weights in place, of course, but they don't tighten the weight plates and therefore the weights do move some on the barbells/dumbells. At least with screw-clamps, one can actually tighten them all the way onto the weights so that they don't move at all. I myself rather have plates totally tightened onto barbells/dumbells so as to have zero give in them moving.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar AT

customer_reviews.title: work great
customer_reviews.text: I use these on small 1 inch bars for arm work with moderate weight (20 to 80lbs). they hold well. I don't drop my weights on the floor so cant say anything on that. I recommend you release the lock when your done training to take the compression off the rubber pads inside the collars, otherwise over time they make get flattened out and not hold anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Victorian Restoration

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased along with some CAP barbells, curling bar, and weights. They work as they should. The fit is tight on the ends and loosens slightly when you move the collar towards the center of the bar. I know others had mentioned some failures after using them for some time. We'll see how they do and update later.
customer_reviews.author: PKS

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea, But flawed execution
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. Fits fine, though there is a small wobble in the weights compared to screw-on clamps. Biggest issue is that the pins keep coming out. Occasionally two at the same joint, so the whole piece opens up. I push them back in, but still out they come. This isn't the end of the world, expect for the fact that if it comes undone weights will fall to the ground... or my foot. Perhaps I just got a dud set.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Some better than others
customer_reviews.text: Ordered multiple sets, some tighter than others. I have small children and need all to be tight so weights don't crush little skulls. A few are easy to slide off barbell but all work to secure weights in place while lifting. I guess it depends in your needs. 4, I like them and recommend, but again yours needs will determine the solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gamache

customer_reviews.title: A Little Tight on the Bar
customer_reviews.text: Works okay. Could use a little more clearance on the barbell bar when disengaged. Maybe my bar is a little too beat up. Locks down well. Easier to use than spring locks.
customer_reviews.author: David M Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Quite simply, not 1"
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about the other people with positive reviews. Maybe they got a slightly different product than I received. That's great for them. Mine: It's 2 hashmarks less than an inch on my ruler. Not an inch. Won't fit over my 1" bar. Now I need to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Perry, the pretty good reviewer

customer_reviews.title: So much better than clips
customer_reviews.text: Love these for the convenience of quick weight adjustments. I may well get another set. However, I am not sure if these would hold a lot of plates sloshhing around on the bar. Luckily that is not something I need to worry about most times. I wish these would fit bars with threads though!
customer_reviews.author: Kristangela

customer_reviews.title: Great collars, definitely for unthreaded bars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect collars, holds the weight extremely well on an unthreaded 1" dumbbell bar. It can hold the weight on a threaded bar as well, but it is much less sturdy and I wouldn't trust heavy weight going over my head with it. However, these are not intended for threaded bars, so it is definitely not a fault of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin LaRose

customer_reviews.title: Great fit on my 1" threaded bar.
customer_reviews.text: These clamps are a great improvement on the screw-on holders on my threaded weight bar. With some of these clamps, reviewers have complained that they don't hold. I haven't found that to be the case, even when I have the bar leaning against a wall in a vertical position. Of course I don't use this bar with a lot of weight--otherwise I would use a bigger bar. There may be some variation in the diameter of these bars. I was curious if the bar I have is exactly 1" in diameter. Using a calibers, I measured at the threaded portion, that it is 95.5/100", pretty close to a full inch.
customer_reviews.author: Windrunner

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable - subject to failure
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 pr. of the 1" collars. They are easy to use. HOWEVER, the metal pins that hold the plastic pieces together slide out of position very easily. If one of the metal pins were to slide out far enough, the collar would fail to hold the weights onto the bar. On several occasions I have had to push metal pin back into place. Overall, I rate this product 2 stars. Over-priced Chinese junk. If you buy these, be sure you inspect each clamp after you have clamped it onto your bar, in order to prevent an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Scooby-Sloth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to change plates
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with a set of dumbells with a screw on locking system. This was tedious as it did not always screw easily. These collars make changing weights so much easier. They fit perfectly and hold the weights well. In addition, they are easy to take on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They have made my life amazingly easier. I use them with a non-threaded regular (not Olympic) barbell. I have had no issue at all with them slipping off or being loose. I was about to purchase them in black, but I took the advice of another reviewer and bought in a color (blue) so they would be easier to spot. I'm glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: S. SmithTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Don't do any dumbell overheads/ Perpendicular
customer_reviews.text: These Clips are great for doing anything parallel to the weights, but if you do something like a dumbbell over head making the weight perpendicular I notice they will loosen. They haven't fell off, but its still something that bugs me so I switch to my classic screw on tighteners when I do anything overhead like that.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the smaller bars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the smaller bars. I bought a plate set at a large sports store and I could not find these smaller size clamps anywhere. A lot of the lifting DVDs I workout to have plate changes and I would have to pause the workout to change plates and now these clamps keep me on pace, LOVE THESE. Packaged well and they ship fast. A Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with them!!
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned up some dumbells that were rusted from sitting in the garage, but I couldn't fix the old clamps so I was happy to find these for the price and my color. So far they are handling well. So much easier to take on and off, and they stay in place. How many spray their weight bars purple and then find purple collars... maybe just me but love that I found these! 💪
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: They work well on the regular, non-threaded barbell. They didn't work on any of my threaded bars. My only Dumbbells are threaded so I didn't try them on those. My suggestion is to open them up and keep the tension off them when you're not lifting. That should extend their life.
customer_reviews.author: JavaMom

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: These were great right out of the box, but of the four I purchased a couple of months ago, two have broken. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Philosopher25

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd set
customer_reviews.text: These work best on threaded bars and are very secure. I ordered a second set and I use them all through my workouts, as changing weights using a threaded nut is annoying and kills time. If you have a smooth bar, you will need the traditional spring type.
customer_reviews.author: KayakFisherman

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: The clamps work well. I trust them to be secure, mostly because they take a little effort getting them on and off. Rating as I did because they work, dropped a little because they’re a little difficult to use on threaded bars as I thought they showed they’d be convenient for. Still easier than threading the existing locking cap.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Works as a secondary clamp.
customer_reviews.text: The lock hinge tends to flip open easily when bumped and it doesn't seem to lock the weights on my dumbbells well enough to give me confidence the weights will not slip out while lifting. I use it as a secondary lock and like it. Too bad, it is a good idea and I like the concept. Safety is only issue.
customer_reviews.author: storm

customer_reviews.title: They worked well for me.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these to use on a 1 inch Champion Barbell E-Z Curl bar (also purchased on Amazon). They fit well and clamp tightly to the bar. No problems with slipping or moving. They open and close well, no problem with them popping open on their own. My only concern is the plastic does doesn’t feel super hard. So far so good, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Semper-Fi

customer_reviews.title: Color is off
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a 4 just because of the color, they are more of a magenta than a red. I was expecting bright blood red, that is my favorite color. Other than that I don't have any complaints. They work excellent for a barbell class such as BodyPump. 💪🏽
customer_reviews.author: Brandie

customer_reviews.title: not fit for a childs fisher price wheight set
customer_reviews.text: they are very cheap. I broke one of them the very first time i used them. these are probobly the worst product ive ever wasted my money on in the history of amazon. if you love throwing money away on styuff that breaks the first time you use them then by all means buy these barbell clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Corey M Rudroff

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable replacement for screw-on collars
customer_reviews.text: These allow me to quickly change plates. However, I wouldn't trust them with very heavy weights. Collars tend to creep away from the plates they're holding in place. Still, I like them for light and moderate weights because they're easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Warriner

customer_reviews.title: Supplement for your spin-locks
customer_reviews.text: I used spin-locks before purchasing these. The spin-lock would always come loose during a workout. So I purchased these clamps. If you use them without the spin-lock they can come loose too with heavy plates. However, if I use the spin-lock and the clamps, they keep the spin-lock from moving. The spin-lock is metallic so it can stand the pressure from large plates. It’s seams to be a good idea to use both with heavy weight. With that said, I like them and they work for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: I remember when the spring type clips came out to make switching out plates a little easier, but with these Greententljs, it is even easier plus the grip is very strong. One more note; when I first put these on my curl bar, triceps bar, and my six foot straight bars, they went on tight, but after removing them a couple times and replacing them they seem to loosen up just fine. My guess is that the tolerances are very close. I have four sets of these collars.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L Rack

customer_reviews.title: Too Big, kept sliding off
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sets of these and was so excited to use them. They were too big for my bars, kept sliding off so I returned them. I was disappointed and was hoping they would fit. If they made the rubber a bit thicker It would fit great. They worked just like the ones at the gym. I would try them out for the price, they might fit your bar, just didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: OMGitsCMG

customer_reviews.title: Yup, they work great
customer_reviews.text: I have the one inch bar, the plates kept slipping every other day and I have to keep tightening the nut which never stayed. Put these clamps on, problem solved. So far I've only had to retighten once after 3 weeks (one side). Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Chimpy

customer_reviews.title: and I just love the simplicity and ease of it
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the regular iron clamps that I had were really difficult to put on the bar. These are so simple and requires little effort. You basically just lift the little black part up, and slide it on. It holds the plates, and I haven't had an issue with it breaking. It does the job, and I just love the simplicity and ease of it.
customer_reviews.author: mystic_c

customer_reviews.title: Bye-bye clumsy clamps
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 sets of these-both work great. They slide on/off our 1" bars easily (we do BodyPump at home). Soooo much faster than those dumb clamps & they hold our weights securely too. If we experience any issues w these, I will update but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan

customer_reviews.title: NO FREE REURNS
customer_reviews.text: UNFORTUNATELY I ORDERED THESE FOR A GIFT AND TTHEY WERE THE WRONG SIZE. I WANTED TO RETURN THEM AND BUY NEW ONES. THEY WANTED TO CHARGE ME $5.99 TO REURN A PRODUCT THAT COSTS $7.99. I DID BUY THE NEW ONES BECAUSE THEY WERE A GHRISTMAS GIFT LIKE I SAID, OTEHRWISE I WOULD NOT HAVE.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth french

customer_reviews.title: These clamps don't hold.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for dead lifts or squats or anything that keeps the bar straight. But for hammer curls, rows, or anything that involves the clamps bearing any actual weight, this style of clamp does not hold for anything over 15 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Spicahontas

customer_reviews.title: Great for Body Pump
customer_reviews.text: I do Les Mills on demand body pump classes at home and these are so much faster and easier to get on/off the Bar than the old squeeze clips I had! I think I have a 1” bar and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Very quick and easy to attached and detached. The only downside to this is it does not totally lock the plates in place so there is movement of the plates rotating when you use your dumbbells. Besides that, it works absolutely great.
customer_reviews.author: punksterz626

customer_reviews.title: They did not seem particularly secure
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to put on my threaded dumbbells. However, they did not seem particularly secure as the weights were spinning around when I was using them. It did not inspire confidence for any exercises I was doing when lifting my dumbbells overhead.
customer_reviews.author: Alucard212

customer_reviews.title: Quick, but not a strong grip
customer_reviews.text: I had the old metal screw-in holding pin type of collars before these and I have gone back to those with time because these have lost their grip strength. These take way less time to put on and take off and the color options are fun, but after using them for several months, they have lost their grip strength and I do not trust them to hold more than 40 lbs of weight plates on a horizontal bar and I would not trust these to hold any amount of weight on a vertical bar.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Barratt

customer_reviews.title: Love them...should have ordered 4
customer_reviews.text: I hated the screw on collars - these are perfect. I should have ordered four [for two dumbbells, one each side]...may order another set of four for my other handles...pricey but worth it for speed of changing weights for super sets.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous. Does not lock in place well. Can slide off of bar!!
customer_reviews.text: Product does not lock very tight, which means it can slide off easily. Could be very dangerous if it slipped off the bar. I would not recommend this to anyone who puts on more then 1 plate on each side. Even then I would not recommend it. Very dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: usforus

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and effective
customer_reviews.text: Effective product. Some reviewers, if my memory is accurate, felt the clamps would not hold under certain conditions, like when tillting the bar, and that may be correct. However, I don't believe the product is intended for that sort of stress. The clamps have worked very well for me. And they fit my one inch diameter bars.
customer_reviews.author: Gary H. Goubeau

customer_reviews.title: Two years in--still holding
customer_reviews.text: I have now used these barbell clamps 4-5 days each week for two years. They still tightly restrain the weights in a slick, nonmetal bar. I am very pleased with these clamps.
customer_reviews.author: ZaideeB

customer_reviews.title: The Future Clamp. Great Value. Great Quality. Super easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: These little clamps are amazing, its like the future. so easy to use and holds weight well. Probably should use the screw and pin clamps for benching/squatting over 300lbs but this is great for any weight under that. very easy to put on and take off makes changing weight super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Used these for an old barbell as I'm getting back into weigh lifting after many years. They clamp very securely and are much easier to fix in place--and have a tighter fit--than the old "spring" style clamps I had used previously. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: If you are not shifting the weights, the clamps will stay in place, but unfortunately, the plates tend to slide as if the clamps are non-existent. If they were made to firmly stay in place I would rate higher.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dependability

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a missing end screw for an adjustable barbell set I bought off of Facebook - I just went off of a guess and luckily they fit perfectly :) so far no issues with slipping or breaking! Great price and perfect delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Riannabelle

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought them!
customer_reviews.text: Starting off with a small set of plates these really save me some time with all the switching I have to do. Thank goodness. Was worried they would feel unsecured but they feel nice and tight!
customer_reviews.author: Rena D.Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Strong, secure and easy on and off.
customer_reviews.text: My husband fashioned a barbell for me so that I can use the weights from his dumbbells and these clamps are fabulous! Easy on and off and very secure. They are sturdy and so far, the quality is great!
customer_reviews.author: Eucharia Pieraccini

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My husband found a weight bar outside of our church dumpster. All we needed was some new clips to hold the weights on! These are the best! Very easy for our young boys to take on and off! Nice bright color options to display a little personality!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G.

product_meta.title: Greententljs 1 Inch Barbell Clamps - Quick Release Pair of Locking 1'' Diameter Standard Bar Weight Plates Collar Clips for Workout Weightlifting Fitness Training Bodybuilding
feature_bullets: 100% Brand New,The Inner Diameter Size:28.05 mm(1.105 inch), The Inner Spring Diameter Size:22.35 mm - 26.67 mm(0.888 Inch -1.050 inch)........PLEASE NOTE THE SIZE(1'',1 INCH,25MM BARBELL CLAMPS),------If you want 2 inch Olympic Please search greententljs 2 inch
Material:reinforced plastic ,ABS (HIGH Quality:Nylon 662),Package Include: Pair of 1 inch Barbell Clamp
This barbell clamp fits for 1 inches standard size.Perfect for crossfit workouts,standard lifts,overhead press,deadlifts,bench press,or any other workout using 1 inches standard barbell.
Satisfaction Guaranteed: If you're unsatisfied with our 1 inch standard barbell clamp, simply return them via Amazon's no hassle returns
Easy to use, one hand install ~ Spring powered,These collars are a favorite for crossfit and many other commercial gyms.
